MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Content.PackageContextFlags IgnoreSecurity = int32(2)

summary.para: Flag for use with : ignore any security restrictions on the Context being requested, allowing it to always be loaded. For use with to allow code to be loaded into a process even when it isn't safe to do so. Use with extreme care!

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Content.PackageContextFlags IncludeCode = int32(1)

summary.para: Flag for use with : include the application code with the context. This means loading code into the caller's process, so that can be used to instantiate the application's classes. Setting this flags imposes security restrictions on what application context you can access; if the requested application can not be safely loaded into your process, java.lang.SecurityException will be thrown. If this flag is not set, there will be no restrictions on the packages that can be loaded, but will always return the default system class loader.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Content.PackageContextFlags Restricted = int32(4)

summary.para: Flag for use with : a restricted context may disable specific features. For instance, a View associated with a restricted context would ignore particular XML attributes.
